summary: Clara is rewatching Dear White People and strongly recommends it to Neela.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi, what you up to?
Character B: Not much, chilling out.
Character A: Just rewatching Dear White People on Netflix, love it!😍
Character B: Oh yeah, heard of it, but not seen it yet? Any good?
Character A: Well, yes! I just said it was, LOL. It's about a fictional Ivy League University and the students in one House of Residence.
Character B: Why is it called Dear White People?
Character A: That's the name of the radio show the main character, Sam, presents on college radio.
Character B: Yeah, but why is it so good?
Character A: Well, it's mainly stories from the perspective of black students there, which I find very interesting. The characters are strong and likeable too.
Character B: I suppose it's rather different from the UK, then?
Character A: It seems so, as there is a lot more racial awareness and discrimination there than here. It all kicks off when there is a Blackface party held by an elite group of white students, which gets out of hand.
Character B: How's that?
Character A: Well, obviously, the black students try to break it up and there's also an incident where one guy, Reggie, gets a loaded gun pointed at him by a campus policeman after he gets into an argument with a white student. It may be at another party, though, I'm not sure of that.
Character B: Oh, that sounds pretty strong stuff. What else happens?
Character A: Well, there is a young black guy called Lionel who is coming to terms with being gay and is finding his voice as a journalist. He unearths corruption at the uni and he and Sam also uncover some conspiracy theory stuff about secret societies.
Character B: Well, I must say, it does sound good, I'll check it out soon!
Character A: Definitely, there is supposed to be a Series 3 coming up next year, really looking forward to it!
Character B: Well, thanks Clara, I'm just watching the rest of a movie and I'll try Dear White People.
Character A: Don't blame me if you get hooked and stay up till 4!
Character B: See ya, love!
Character A: Bye!

summary: Beth wants to organize a girls weekend to celebrate her mother's 40th birthday. She also wants to work at Deidre's beauty salon. Deidre offers her a few hours on Saturdays as work experience. They set up for a meeting tomorrow.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi Beth, how are you love?
Character B: Hi Auntie Deirdre, I'm been meaning to message you, had a favour to ask.
Character A: Wondered if you had any thought about your Mum's 40th, we've got to do something special!
Character B: How about a girls weekend, just mum, me, you and the girls, Kira will have to come back from Uni, of course.
Character A: Sounds fab! Get your thinking cap on, it's only in 6 weeks! Bet she's dreading it, I remember doing that!
Character B: Oh yeah, we had a surprise party for you, you nearly had a heart attack! 
Character A: Well, it was a lovely surprise! Gosh, thats nearly 4 years ago now, time flies! What was the favour, darling?
Character B: Oh, it was just that I fancied trying a bit of work experience in the salon, auntie.
Character A: Well, I am looking for Saturday girls, are you sure about it? you could do well in the exams and go on to college or 6th form.
Character B: I know, but it's not for me, auntie, I am doing all foundation papers and I'm struggling with those.
Character A: What about a tutor? Kira could help you in the hols.
Character B: Maybe, but I'd like to try working. I'm 16 soon, I'm old enough.
Character A: I know. Look, pop in tomorrow after school and we'll have a cuppa and a chat.
Character B: Yes, thanks auntie. I'd really like to try the beauty therapy side.
Character A: Its not for the squeamish, mind. Massage, pedicures, not to mention waxing!
Character B: Oh yes, I was chatting to a friend about it yesterday!
Character A: Maxine manages the beauty side, you can meet her tomorrow and we'll see how it goes.
Character B: Yes, I'd really like that. 
Character A: We can try a few hours on a Saturday for a couple of weeks as work experience. I'll give you a tenner or so per session to start off for your lunch, coffee and bus fare etc. If you like, we'll take it from there.
Character B: OK, I like the sound of it! See you tomorrow Auntie! Love you!
Character A: Bye, lovely girl! Xx

Character A: <file_photo>

summary: Sandra and Brenda used to work together in the clothes factory 25 years ago. Sandra still lives in Kings Norton. Brenda lives in Stoke now. Her husband Bill died 5 years ago. They will meet in Birmingham for a lunch next Saturday about 11. They want to organize a reunion for the Lister's girls.
dialogue:
Character A: Hello, is this Sandra Donovan?
Character B: Yes, well that was my maiden name, it's Sandra Taylor now.
Character A: It's Brenda Riley, we used to work together in the clothes factory!
Character B: Oh my God! Bren! How are you, it must be 25 years!
Character A: I'm fine, I live in Stoke now, moved away from Brum in the late 90s.
Character B: I still live in Kings Norton, same house, same husband! I've got 4 grandchildren now, ages 2, 4, 9 and 15! How about you?
Character A: Unfortunately, my husband Bill died 5 years ago, I have only one grandchild, she's 7, my little angel, she doesn't remember her Gramps. 
Character B: So sorry, love, I remember your Bill, he had long black hair and massive sideburns, didn't he?
Character A: Well, yes, about 45 years ago, he was bald when he passed away. He loved to dance, he did Northern Soul, we both did actually. Went up to Wigan on weekends, happy times!
Character B: Oh yes, I remember that craze, bit energetic for me! We liked disco instead! We had some great dinner dances with the factory, do you remember them?
Character A: Yes! Us all dressed up with our long dresses and the men with their frilly evening shirts, lovely memories!
Character B: Do you still see any of the girls from Lister's?
Character A: No, but I heard that Marigold Carter died, very sad.
Character B: Hey Bren, I've had a brainwave! How about we organise a reunion for the Lister's girls, look on social media for them?
Character A: Actually, I was thinking along those lines! Do you fancy meeting up, just you and me? I can come down to Birmingham anytime.
Character B: That would be lovely! Can you manage it next Saturday? We could meet about 11ish and go for lunch and a good old trip down memory lane!
Character A: Oh yes! I'd love that! I'll get back to you about train times soon!
Character B: Ok! Bye love!

Character A: What if he doesn't leave? I'm afraid of asking him to leave 'cause it will only cause another fight.
Character B: You can't spend your whole life walking on eggshells.

Character B: I think you've got to cut your losses and just move on.

Character A: I just don't get it. Every morning I approach my wardrobe, open it, choose the clothes I want to wear or prepare them the previous day and that's it. I don't need an app to tell me what to wear with what.
Character B: Okay... Let's play a game. 
Character A: You're not going to make me cut my fingers off?
Character B: No ;) how many pairs of trousers do u have?
Character A: 5 or 6.
Character B: How many shirts do you have?
Character A: T-shirts or regular shirts?

Character A: 3 or 4.
Character B: What about jackets?
Character A: 2.
Character B: Great! Now imagine I have 12 shirts, 10 pairs of trousers, and 6 jackets. And I have to decide what to wear in a split second.
Character A: All right. It's slowly dawning on me.

summary: Hannah's New Year's resolutions are: work out, cook for herself, start dating. Brooklyn didn't make any. In the past she had, but she never fulfilled them.
dialogue:
Character B: HAPPY NEW YEAR!!! :))) 
Character A: Same to you! Have you made any New Year's resolutions? ;>
Character B: A whole list ^^
Character B: New year, new me :D
Character A: Really? :D So how you're going to change your life this year?
Character B: First, I'm gonna lose weight and exercise everyday (or at least 3 times a week).
Character B: Second, I want to learn how to cook and start meal prepping
Character B: Finally, I'm gonna find my future husband (or at least start using dating apps):D
Character B: And you? Have you set any goals for 2019?
Character A: Hmm, interesting :D especially the last point ^^
Character A: Yeah, just one - not to make any resolutions.
Character B: Whyyyy??
Character A: I just don't believe that a new year means a fresh start.
Character A: Every past year I told myself I would lose weight, quit smoking, start going to the gym etc. And I'm still a fatty, who smokes like a chimney and rarely leaves their couch.
Character B: You're a little ray of sunshine, aren't you? ;)
Character A: :p And you're an undaunted optimist. What makes you believe that everything is going to change for the better?
Character B: I don't know, I just like to think that we get numerous second chances to change our lives, to make right what's wrong.
Character B: That's it, I don't have any better explanation.
Character A: Well, you haven't convinced me. :) Nevertheless good luck with all your resolutions. ;)
Character B: Thanks! :*

Character B: Hey Mitch, how are you? I hope you're doing ok. We are thinking of signing up Bill for that International camp. Sammy will be going too. Do you think it would be possible for you to take Bill and Sammy if you go down?
Character A: I'm doing well - pretty tired. Yes, I do think that's possible :)
Character B: Great, that would mean a lot to us. Thanks a lot. 
Character A: That'd be wonderful! July, I'll be at a few camps ;)
Character B: Of course, we'll chip in for gas. Ok, no problem :)
Character A: Thx, no worries. I hope you're all doing well. Time is flying by ;)
Character B: Ok, great. I know, it's crazy.
Character B: Do you know exactly which date you'll be leaving?
Character A: Sunday, the 29th
Character B: Ok, cool. It's such a long drive.
Character A: Yeah, around 1000 km, but I'll try to get there early Mon morning.
Character B: That's a pretty ambitious undertaking :)
Character A: I have to, camp starts Mon 9.
Character B: Just be careful, and take lots of breaks, don't fall asleep at the wheel, etc.
Character A: I'll have the boys to keep me awake, and lots of snacks :)
Character B: Ok. We will probably put Bill on a Flixbus, so he'll arrive around 10 am Sun
Character A: Cool, just make sure he has his phone on him.
Character B: Ok, no problem. We'll give him your number, but most likely Joanna will be picking him up.
Character A: Oh, ok. That makes things easier. I'll meet him after.
Character B: Great, thanks a lot for doing this, I don't know how else we would get him down to Croatia.
Character A: No problem. Talk to you later.
Character B: Ok, bye.

summary: Jamie has never gone ghost hunting but Harriette did with her friends once in high school. They did not see any ghosts and she only got frightened by a cat's miaowing.

Character A: Yeah, once when I was in high school! There was a run-down building in the neighbourhood and we went to investigate it with my friends
Character B: How was it? Did you find something?
Character A: We didn't see any ghosts, haha
Character A: But let me tell you that I never thought I'd freak out this much at hearing a cat meow
Character A: There's just something about the atmosphere... that makes you overreact and find normal but unexpected things really creepy
Character B: I guess that's part of the experience? :p
Character A: Yeah, if I could choose again, I'd probably still decide to go - I don't regret it! But I definitely wouldn't try something like that alone ^^;

summary: Nestor wanted to buy a laptop on Black Friday sales, but Olaf advise against it, as the prices in reality are not reduced. Nestor will check it if Olaf helps him to get a good deal from a guy he knows.
dialogue:
Character B: I'm thinking of buying a new laptop
Character B: And it seems that now is a perfect time for it as Black Friday is coming
Character A: Hahaha
Character B: I haven't said anything funny, what's wrong with you
Character A: Everything's fine with me, you're just being silly
Character B: Why, cuz I want to save some money buying what I need when it's cheaper?
Character B: Do you actually know what Blak Friday is about?
Character A: Of course I know
Character A: It's a cunningly contrived sales pitch
Character A: Prices are thought to be reduced but in fact they're the same or even higher...
Character B: You're just repeating a stupid theory some people made up and try to convince others that it's based on facts
Character A: You're really naive...
Character A: <file_other>
Character A: Click on this link and see for yourself
Character A: This is one of the sites where people upload photos of the same product and its price 2 weeks before Black Friday and during the promotion
Character B: And how do I know whether it's a reliable source or not?
Character A: Carry out your own investigation
Character A: Go and check prices of the chosen products when the promotion is still on and check them again when the promotion is over
Character A: Simple
Character B: What if the laptop I want has been really cheaper and I'll miss a perfect deal?
Character A: Then I'll help you
Character A: I know a dude who sells almost new computers at very reasonable prices
Character B: So ask him to send the offer of what he has in stock to me first
Character B: If he can offer me a good deal, I'm going to the mall and starting investigation tomorrow
Character B: Deal?
Character A: Deal!
Character A: I'll call or text him and ask to contact you.
Character A: I'm sure he'll help you and you'll appreciate my advice :-)
Character B: We'll see about that

summary: Nancy asks Vic and Phil about various social media, which prompts them to discuss and compare the different platforms. Phil is not into Instagram but likes Twitter. Vic prefers Facebook over Twitter and likes Instagram. Phil and Vic both don't use Tumblr.
dialogue:
Character B: Yeah, but u can also read the news online ;)
Character A: I know, but imagine - ur keen on technology and u get all the news in one place. Then u can choose what to read and what not.
Character B: Sounds sensible. Does it have something 4 fashion?
Character A: Probably so. Not sure, though.
Character B: How about u, Vic?
Character C: I still prefer Facebook. Had Twitter once, but the interaction with others is nothing compared with Facebook.
Character A: Well, it's intended in a completely different way. 
Character C: What do u mean?
Character A: IMO, Twitter is not for interacting like on Facebook, but for getting news fast and from reliable, more or less, sources. U can follow anyone and anyone can follow u.
Character C: Still, on Facebook I can share stuff with my friends, join groups and talk about things that interest me. And I don't have to limit myself to 140 characters.
Character A: 280. Still, a downside. OTOH, if ppl were able to write as much as they wanted, Twitted would get as cluttered as Facebook.
Character B: So no one uses 4 example Instagram?
Character C: I do. 
Character A: Not 4 me. I don't post that many pictures online. 
Character B: But u can follow ppl and see what they're doing or offering. There are also companies on Instagram.
Character A: I know, but I'm more interested in news and gossip than seeing someone post a picture of their breakfast. 
Character C: That's not all ppl post on Instagram!
Character A: So, what else?
Character C: Depends on ur interest. I, for one, like to observe all the fitness accounts :)
Character A: And does this motivate u to train?
Character C: No, but it gives me hints what to do and what not. 
Character B: What do u think about Tumblr?
Character A: What?
Character C: Heard about it, but never had an account.
Character B: It's a microblogging website. U can post blog entries, pictures and basically everything u want there. And ppl can observe u!
Character A: Don't have that much time to write a blog.
Character C: Me neither. 
Character A: Nancy, y do u ask these questions? ;)
Character B: I have my reasons ;)

summary: Catherine applied for an accounting position at Pandora. Jake has been working there for 5 years. This job offers a clear career path and benefits. Jake got promoted twice with salary increase. Catherine will have an interview on Monday.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi Jake, last week I applied for an accounting position @ Pandora.
Character B: Hey Cathy! Really? That's great!
Character A: R u still working there?
Character B: I sure am. It's already been 5 yrs.
Character A: Time flies. So I take it ur satisfied?
Character B: I am, I rarely think about changing companies. 
Character A: Does the company offer possibilities of personal development & promotion?
Character A: I mean is there a clear career path?
Character B: Yup, that's the main pro of this place & the benefits.
Character B: I was promoted twice during these 5 yrs & the salary increase with each promotion is quite significant.
Character A: That's good to hear. Most companies 2day are implementing cost saving policies & the employees are the ones who suffer.
Character A: I mean at my current workplace u can only count on inflation salary increases. So u barely see the difference on ur paycheck.
Character B: That's what I hear from most of my friends. It's a tough time 4 employees on the market nowadays.
Character B: 4 now our company is still dynamically expanding. 
Character A: And how about the benefits u mentioned?
Character B: The company partially finances language & accounting courses.
Character B: There's also a yearly bonus that depends on your achievements and private healthcare.
Character A: That sounds like a dream :D Your HR dept. gave me a call yesterday and invited me to an interview on Monday.
Character B: That's great! I'll keep my fingers crossed :)
Character A: Thanks Jake :) Is there anything I should prepare/review before the interview?
Character B: Well I think it would be beneficial to know some facts about the company.
Character B: You can find them on the official website, in the "about us" section:  <file_other> 
Character A: OK, I'll definitely take a look.
Character B: And they may ask u some Qs about accounting principles, the basics. But I mean that won't be a problem 4 u.
Character B: I remember u graduated with honours from uni.
Character A: That's true. :) I'm a bit nervous though.
Character B: There's no need to be. Give me a call after the interview. Good luck!
Character A: Thanks. TTYS!

summary: Ronnie uses three different bins for waste. He doesn't use straws, neither plastic bags. Clint and Ronnie agree that environment protection depends on the government.
dialogue:
Character A: I'm curious. How's the waste management working out over there?
Character B: It actually works very well. We use three different bins: compost, recycle and trash. Compost anything organic from yard waste to food scraps. Recycle for paper, bottles, cardboard, plastic, metals. And trash everything else. Why do you ask?
Character A: Sheer curiosity. What about general awareness? Plastic bags, etc.?
Character B: Very high. No more single use plastic bags in grocery stores. No more straws in restaurants.
Character A: Yeah, I read yours was one of the cities that banned them. I wonder when that will get here.
Character B: Never...
Character A:: What do you mean?
Character B: I highly doubt that type of environmental awareness will happen there. People there live in a different world when it comes to that.
Character A: People don't have to have any awareness, tbh. It's above them. If there were such decisions made they would follow
Character B: That is true. But at the state government level I don't think there is that awareness either. But hopefully I am proven wrong!
Character A: Really bizarre. I noticed it's struggling here. On the other hand, it's money.
Character B: Money in the sense of?
Character A: Reducing waste=lower utilization costs. Do they sort through everything further down?
Character B: Yes here they do. 
Character A: It seems to be the same way here. Dry recyclables, food and general, compost

summary: Sophie accepts some quince from Noah. Noah has left the quince in a basket on his terrace and the twins can pick it up any time. The twins are in college. Noah's son is in the military. He is still single but reportedly not gay.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi there! The quince we talked about the other day... Are you still interested?
Character B: Hello Noah, but of course I am.Thank you.
Character A: Actually William went to collect the rest of them for you immediately. They're in a basket on our terrace, so you call collect them any time.
Character B: That's very very kind of him! He's really a darling.
Character B: We won't be going your direction any time soon I'm afraid. How long will they keep? Is it windfall?
Character A: Both really but they all look very healthy. No bruises afa one can see. Or only odd small ones. They' be alright for a couple of days I guess. The weather's cool.
Character B: It would be a shame if they rotted. I'll talk to Frank and maybe to the twins too and go back to you asap.
Character A: OK.
Character B: Hey Noah, the twins will be on their way from Notts tomorrow afternoon and passing Windfield. Is it alright if they pop in and collect the quince?
Character A: Absolutely! In fact anyone can come any time and just take them from our terrace. Of course it would be great to see your twins again. Haven't seen them for ages!
Character B: Well we don't see that much of them either :( They'll be coming home this weekend only because of Alexa's ceremony.
Character A: Notts is 3 hours' drive away so small wonder they don't fancy it so much.
Character B: I don't blame them! We're both happy they've been doing fine at college. Everything's absolutely fine. You don't have William at home all that often either, do you?
Character A: He gets 5 days at Xmas by way of "family care" and 2 weeks off spread over the whole year but never longer that 5 days. They have a strict regime at the academy. But after all these years we've learned to cope with it. What worries me is that he seems to have no time to even think about getting married and start a family of his own.
Character B: The fate of most military I guess. Hugely unfair I'd say. Like being married to your regiment!
Character A: That's what it sounds like when he talks about himself! I never hear a girl's name! And when I ask, he gets brusque.
Character B: Oh dear! What could it mean?
Character A: No, not what you think! We know from Capt. Broomsberg about their common escapades. Plenty of women but only that sort of women. No strings.
Character B: I never even imagined he might be gay! Surely not. But there must be sth else.
Character A: We think he's just so obsessively career-minded. Nothing else counts for him.
Character B: He's always been very strong-willed. And he knows what he wants. Well if I were you I wouldn't worry at all.
Character A: You're probably right. But you know I'd love it so much to have plenty of grandchildren around me.
Character B: They'll come, don't you worry! Look the twins will contact you about the quince. Alright?
Character A: Sure. Thank you Sophie for a nice chat!
Character B: Thank you for the quince!

summary: Olivia has to sort out her accounts and upload a few videos on YouTube. Jake is complaining that Sony Music tried to appropriate his own music.
dialogue:

Character A: Like what?
Character B: I ought to do my accounts. At least get all the incoming and outgoing invoices sorted by months.
Character A: Tax filing is a long way off.
Character B: I know, but doing it all at the last minute is a dreadful headache.
Character A: Anything else?
Character B: I also have a few videos I need to upload to YouTube.
Character A: Already ready or you still need to do post-production?
Character B: I don't really do much by way of post-production. I'm not exactly Steven Spielberg.
Character A: I do, but I dont always have time to do much.
Character B: If I put in any music I always get a copyright strike and someone else is taking the ad revenue
Character A: Yeah. And some of those claims are purely speculative. One time I put on one of my own pieces and it was challenged by Sony Music
Character B: No way!
Character A: It's true. On the form you fill in to counter the claim I said if Sony want to make me one of their signed artists, that's fine. Otherwise to get they paws off of my music.

summary: Emily's a guest at Linda's house. She broke one of Linda's green tea cups when she was cleaning the cupboards. Linda doesn't like them and she offers Emily the whole set.

Character B: I'm feeling so bad about it. So clumsy of me.
Character A: Look. I never really liked the set, so one cup makes no difference. I hardly use it anyway. How come it was on the table BTW?
Character B: I was cleaning the cupboards in the dining room.
Character A: You did what? Whatever for? The crockery there is more for decoration.
Character B: Exactly. I thought they're so pretty, especially the green ones, and then noticed how dusty they are. So I thought I'd be a helpful guest and wash them. I did. And then I made myself a cuppa in the green one. And it happened.
Character A: Ya golden! Really! Look, calm down. You are a fantastic guest.
Character B: Ya. Smashing. As we say in GB.
Character A: You know what? Take out the whole green set. If you like it so much - it is yours.

Character B: Really!.
Character A: Return on investment is much higher than if I give money under term savings in the Bank.
Character B: You make sense for money.
Character A: The interest rates are very small, almost close to zero, "only they do not ask you to pay them, for holding money in the Bank".
Character B: O yes.
Character A: Prices of garage places, in Belgrade, will only grow.
Character B: Really!.
Character A: Yes, there are more and more vehicles in the city center, as the number of vehicles per family is growing. It used to be about one vehicle per family, and now it's approaching an average of two vehicles.

Character A: And there will not be new parking space.

summary: Brett's cousin met his wife while playing a game together. Andrew's favorite game is the Final Fantasy. Brett and John haven't heard about it.
dialogue:
Character A: So what do u do there? Drive a tank all the time?
Character C: Yes and no. U've got players from around the world and they have their tank squadrons and u battle them. Can be a lot of fun!
Character B: So what happens if someone is on a higher level than u? They basically destroy u!
Character C: That's not a problem. The game doesn't allow higher ranked players o interact with players out of their range.
Character A: What do u mean?
Character C: If ur on lvl 5, a player on lvl 30 can't attack u. 
Character B: Sensible. Unlike WoW.
Character C: So what's WoW like?
Character B: Imagine having a character u rly like and u give it a lot of ur attention and get experience point, level up and so on. Someone who's played the game for like a year comes and kills u instantly.
Character A: Not cool. 
Character C: Yeah. Y would they allow such a thing?
Character B: Well, open world, u can team up with anyone, do quests together, arrange fighting tactics and so on.
Character A: Actually, my cousin met his wife there :)
Character C: Rly?
Character A: Yeah. They were playing together for some time, talking and at some point he invited her to a date. Turned out they lived very close to each other ;)
Character B: That's gr8! And how are they getting along now?
Character A: Most fights are about who gets 2 play at a given moment ;) 
Character C: Lol
Character B: Well my favourite genre is RPGs :)
Character C: Can u name a title, except WoW?
Character B: I can name a dozen, but one of my personal faves is the Final Fantasy series :)
Character A: What's this one about?
Character B: Don't tell me u haven't heard about the greatest RPG series of all times?
Character C: Well, I haven't.
Character B: I think I'll have to look for new friends... So embarrassing.
Character A: C'mon! Tell us!
Character B: Fine... Usually u play a group of friends that have to resolve some kind of crisis. In the last part u play a prince whose kingdom has been destroyed and u try to well get revenge.
Character A: Sounds boring. 
Character B: Believe me, it's not!

summary: Rael finds the atmosphere at her workplace to be unbearable. Many people switch their career paths and move to the IT sector. Rael only needs good analytical skills and an on-line course to start work in IT.
dialogue:
Character B: Gosh, I fucking hate my job!
Character A: Oops! Someone is in a mood...
Character B: I'm serious, I'm done. Those people are fucked up. I cannot stand it anymore.
Character A: Is it that bad?
Character B: Even worse...
Character A: What this time?
Character B: I don't even have time to eat my fucking lunch. It's not normal.
Character A: Did you talk to your manager?
Character B: Yeah, this retard doesn't get that we're humans not robots. I hate him.
Character A: You're gonna quit?
Character B: It's not that easy, I gotta find something. I don't want to leave without first finding a new job.
Character A: I see. Did you think about IT?
Character B: No, why?
Character A: Girl, it's the best place to work in! A lot of my friends started as software testers and they are really satisfied. Good money and no rat race.
Character B: Zach, are you crazy? I don't have technical studies.
Character A: You don't have to. If you have good analytical skills all you need is some online course - Udemy or something. People change their career after years of employment in totally different business. It's not that difficult, really. You should give it a try. Tech is our future.
Character B: Hmm... Maybe you're right. I'm still not sure what to do with my career, so... why not.
Character A: If you want, I can talk to my friends and they will give you some advice on how to start, what courses to choose and so on.
Character B: That would be great, thanks.
Character A: UW. In touch.

summary: John and Annie are moving to London because he lost his job in Germany and found a better offer working in IT here. Annie isn't happy with the move. Amber, who was supposed to stay in their London flat for 5 years, has to move. Erin offers her place but Amber plans on staying with John and Annie.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi Erin, guess what, John and Annie are coming back to London!
Character B: Hi Amber, wow that's news.
Character B: What caused the change of plans?
Character A: John lost his job in Germany! 
Character B: What :O Seriously?
Character A: Yeah, his whole team got liquidated.
Character B: No way!?
Character A: Yeah, and he was the only one who received an offer from the company to be relocated back to London.
Character B: OK, well at least he's not unemployed.
Character A: But he didn't accept it.
Character B: Why not?!
Character A: B/c they only offered him the job after a month & during that time he started searching for a new one.
Character A: He got a better offer from a different IT company in London.
Character B: Well good for him! 
Character B: Since they weren't able to appreciate his work and they didn't offer him something right away.
Character A: Exactly, but you know what this means for me?
Character B: You're going to have to search for a new flat...
Character A: Yup, we had an agreement that I would be renting their place until they returned from Germany.
Character A: But you know, they planned to be there for at least 5 yrs.
Character B: I can imagine that Annie isn't happy with this turn of events.
Character A: She's pretty pissed off.
Character A: I mean the plan was to save up for a house and only then come back to London.
Character A: She had already enrolled in German classes & they were starting to feel at home there.
Character B: That's too bad. Sometimes life turns out to be unpredictable.
Character B: If you need somewhere to stay for a while, you can always stay at my place.
Character A: Thanks Erin! Annie already told me not to worry, that I can stay with them until I don't find something new.
Character A: But I've already started searching.
Character B: Good luck and let me know if you need any help!
Character A: Thanks, ttyl.
Character B: Bye!

summary: Samuel's language is Telugu, which is spoken in south east India. It has nearly 90 million speakers; it's written left to right; it's based on Brahmin script. Teluguland has 23 provinces. It's quite poor. "Anna" means "elder brother" and Thammu or Thammadu - "younger brother". Tim's 55, Samuel's 35.
dialogue:
Character A: Are you there, Anna?
Character B: I am, but I am not called Anna. It's Tim.
Character A: Sorry, brother Tim. Anna is just the word for elder brother in my language.
Character B: It's a girl's name here. Doesn't sound very brother-like.
Character A: My apologies. 
Character B: So what is your language?
Character A: It is Telugu, brother. 
Character B: is that spoken in India?
Character A: Yes, in South east India. Bangalore and Chennai and other places. Nearly 90 million speakers, brother.
Character B: Is it one of those written right to left?
Character A: No, it is written left to right. It is based on Brahmin script, our writing. If you trace it back far enough it all comes from the Phoenicians, like English writing the same.
Character B: Wow. 
Character B: So it must be pretty big, then, Teluguland?
Character A: It is 23 provinces, Anna. But we are not rich as in the north, so many people here are still working for less than a hundred dollars a whole month.
Character B: So what is the word for "younger brother" if "Anna" means "elder brother?"
Character A: Thammu or Thammadu. You can call me Thammu. I am younger than you.
Character B: how old are you, I would have sid about the same as me in your photo.
Character A: How old are you, Anna? 
Character B: 55
Character A: Well there you are you see. I am 35 only. So you are my Anna and I am your Thammadu. 
Character B: Wow sorry to say it but you do look old for 35:
Character A: That is because it is not an easy life when you are not earning much money, Anna. We work very hard and have very little. But still we are thankful for what we do have.

summary: Maria wants to work as a freelancer. Spencer is an artist. The agency and social media help him to get new clients. He earns around £1000 a month. Spencer encourages Maria to develop her talent and to try freelancing.

Character A: Yeah, thanks love! How's the call centre?

Character A: Yeah, pity they won't allow it for a year. I'm on 16 fixed hours at the cafe which suits me great. I've then got the rest of the week to work on my illustrations.
Character B: How do you get new clients, Spence? I really need to pick your brains sometimes!
Character A: Well, some of them saw my printing in the shops I sell to and contacted me directly, then there's the agency and my social media stuff. I probably get around £1000  of work a month now, before commission and tax.
Character B: Well that's just about liveable with the cafe wage, I imagine.
Character A: Yes, it's tight, but I am very frugal. Still have a hefty chunk going out on rent and bills.
Character B: Hmm, I'll have to budget carefully when I do it.
Character A: Yes, but it's well worth it. I LOVE the work so much!
Character B: Well, your passion is obvious! Your stuff is amazing!
Character A: Well, so was yours in Uni. Don't let your talent go to waste!
Character B: You've inspired me, Spence. See you soon, hopefully!
Character A: See ya!

summary: Tim wants to organise a board games night for his colleagues. Joe has some good ideas and tips on where to start.
dialogue:
Character B: Hey, you have a few minutes?
Character A: Sure, what's up?
Character B: I'm thinking about inviting a few people from work over and I kinda thought that maybe some boardgames would be a cool idea.
Character B: And I wanted to consult the expert on the matter :)
Character A: As you know I'm always happy to share my expertise with anyone willing to listen. You will just need to stop me when I get too wound up :D
Character B: Haha :) Ok, So I know you ran the local club - any tips how to organize a newbie gaming evening? And what games to bring?
Character A: yeah, sure - just a few general tips :)
Character A: Start games before you start drinking :) And don't bring any game that is either over-complicated, requires too much time to explain, or god forbid encourages direct conflict - you know, the plotting-scheming stuff. So no Game of Thrones :)
Character A: Or alternatively you can chose some cooperative games - like Arkham Horror, Robinson Crusoe, Pandemic
Character B: Got it :D 
Character A: Also would be great to know what theme they all like - if there is one. And if not then there are some 'vanilla' games - like Codenames or Catan. Any idea what they might be into? 
Character B: Not really - there are some guys who I know like sci-fi and comic books, but no idea about the girls... 
Character A: The best way - just talk with them - might be surprised by their tastes and experiences. Maybe some of them are already into gaming? There are nerds in every walk of life :)
Character B: Yeah, I know, all too well :)
Character B: Anyway, thanks for the tips - co-op games sound like a good idea for a start.
Character A: yeah, and then if the idea sticks you can roll out the big guns :)
Character B: Will do that :)

summary: Gloria and Mell plan to have a barbeque at Mell's place on Saturday. They are happy, because Tad's sister moved to Scotland. Mell needs Gloria's advice on garden design.
dialogue:
Character A: Hi there! How are you doing?
Character B: Hi Mell! We are fine, just the daily grind ;) And yourselves?
Character A: Not much happening either. An odd phone call with the kids. Or Tad's sister:(( Not much otherwise.
Character B: Yeah... Life has become so quite since the kids are out of the house. We had more to get used to it. But it must hard for you. Especially you I mean.
Character A: I don't know. Sometimes I even forget that I should be missing them. In a way I do like this peace and quiet now.
Character B: Small wonder. You had a hell of a time with them just before they went to college. I'd say you need to recover now.
Character A: I guess you're right. But maybe I should feel guilty or something?
Character B: Don't be silly! You are a fantastic mom.
Character A: Thanks Gloria.
Character B: Anyway I'm happy to hear from you again. We should really have a nice do again.
Character A: YES! Splendid!
Character B: The weather is just brilliant, perfect for a BBQ. What do you think?
Character A: I'm all for it. At my place? I'd love it.
Character B: Can't be better. I love your garden.
Character A: We're thinking about extending the terrace. I must show you my drawings, just a few ideas. It would be great to hear your opinion.
Character B: I'd love to. But you know how little I know about garden design, or however you call it.
Character A: We'll have a look at them. Now the BBQ. At the weekend I suppose?
Character B: Let me check the calendar. Here's our family planner. A horrible name, isn't it? So this weekend suits us fine. At the next one, on Saturday, Mark has penciled something in but I can't read it. So what about this Saturday?
Character A: Perfect. At least we know the weather holds. Shall I do the food and you the drinks?
Character B: And I'll get us some dessert as well. 
Character A: Very good indeed. It's always so easy going with you.
Character B: Ta! You were thinking about Tad's sister?
Character A: I'm afraid so. I'm so happy she moved up to Scotland and I don't have to put up with her trying to run my household. Tad feels relieved too.
Character B: Good riddance! I could really never warm up to her.
Character A: Nobody can! Anyway she's gone and we're going to have a fantastic barbecue. Without her.
Character B: Yes, we are. Oh I'm so happy you've phoned!
Character A: Looking forward to our BBQ on Saturday!
Character B: So long!

summary: Betty's house has mould due to condensation. Andy will send her a quote for the work needed by Friday.
dialogue:
Character B: Hello. I have had a good look and have done some tests on the mould in your spare bedroom upstairs and in the dinign room.
Character A: Hello Andy. Thank you for that, what are your thoughts? 
Character B: I think it is caused by condensation, as most of the moist settles on and around the windows.
Character A: Why is that?
Character B: Those are the coldest areas and therefore where the moist in the warm air turns into water. On the windows its just water, on the walls the moist will allow mould to grow.
Character A: So why is it all over the spare room walls, and all around the dining room? but not in other rooms?
Character B: Probably because they have external walls which are cooler than internal walls.
Character A: so why only that bedroom and not the other ones?
Character B: I guess those rooms are most effected as the spare room is next to the bathroom and the dining room next to the kitchen.
Character A: But why isnt there mould on the kitchen and bathroom itself then?
Character B: I think that is because the kitchen doesn't have external walls and the bathroom has only one external wall and a fan in it. The difference when i measured it between internal wall and external wall is about 4 degrees.  
Character A: Does that mean we need new double glazed windows or new wall insulation?
Character B: Not necessarily. that would make a little difference but would still leave you with moist air in the house, so it would just settle somewhere else.  
Character A: So what would you recommend?
Character B: I would install a fan system, or PIV system, which would circulate air to dilute and take some moisture out of the air. It would be installed in your loft and be on continuously during day and night. 
Character A: That sounds good. would that be sufficient? 
Character B: If you buy a decent size it will be, but you would also need to treat your walls to get rid of the current mould. That will not go away by itself.
Character A: OK, is this something your company can help with?
Character B: It is indeed, we can repaint as well if you want. 
Character A: Good point. Could you please send me a detailed quote for the work via email?
Character B: Of course, I will have that done by Friday. 
Character A: That would be great. And again, thanks for today!
Character B: No problem, speak soon.

summary: Josie finds Eco's novel "Foucault's Pendulum" nerdy. Josie would like to read Eco in Italian, but she's unsure of her language abilities. Stefano considers Eco's two novels and finds them difficult. Josie has read an unfavorable review of "Foucault's Pendulum" by Salman Rushdie.
dialogue:
Character B: Hi, Josie!
Character A: Ciao, Stefano!
Character B: So, what about Foucault's Pendulum? Do you like it?
Character A: It's... weird. Was it really written by an Italian guy? It's so... nerdy.
Character B: Oh well, in a sense Eco was the king of nerds. And, you know, not all Italian books are about pizza, mafia and mandolino. :P
Character A: Yes, I know... I should try and read one of his novels in the original, but I'm not sure my level of Italian is adequate.
Character B: The Name of the Rose is really difficult for a foreign speaker of Italian, you know.
Character A: And what about Foucault's Pendulum?
Character B: Well, it's set in the 1980s, so the language is definitely more comprehensible. The content, however, is just as complicated as in the other novel.
Character A: Btw, I read Salman Rushdie's review of Pendulum, published in the 80s.
Character B: Really? What did he say?
Character A: He hated it and said that it's not a novel, but rather a computer game.
Character B: What? Rotfl!
Character A: That's what Salman said...
Character B: Oh well, de gustipus non est disputandum...
Character A: De gustiBus!
Character B: I know, it was a typo!
Character A: Disgusting pus!
Character B: Hahaha.

Character A: I know. ;)

summary: Bobby's most annoyed by pharmaceutical companies. He believes they invent diseases to make money. He discovered that one company is selling mints as medicine for an illness that doesn't exist.
dialogue:
Character B: U know what annoys me the most?
Character A: Not being able to watch TV or listen to music without pesky interruptions?
Character B: That too, but the thing that annoys me the most is pharmaceuticals, medicine and drugs.
Character A: Y? Aren't they good 4 ur health?
Character B: They may well be, but not for my wallet!
Character A: What do u mean?
Character B: I was watching a film last night and suddenly there's a bunch of commercial of different medical products and so on.
Character A: And what of it?
Character B: Imagine that pharmaceutical companies invent illnesses!
Character A: What? Are u sure?
Character B: No, I'm not, but in the commercial they mentioned a name of an illness I have never heard of.
Character A: So what? There are many illnesses and diseases I've never heard of. 
Character B: So I did some research. Turns out such a thing does not exist. No medical journal writes about it, no medical forum suggests caution.
Character A: That doesn't mean it doesn't exist. 
Character B: I even found a youtube video of a doctor explaining y it's not an illness. 
Character A: All right, this is quite serious.
Character B: So I put my mind to it and do u know what I came up with?
Character A: What?
Character B: That in this particular case they're selling mints as medical products!
Character A: Srsly?!
Character B: Absolutely!
Character A: How long do u think they've been lying to us?
Character B: Can't be sure, but probably 4ever. Imagine every illness, disease and so on. Where do these come from? Why do they spread so fast?
Character A: That is kinda puzzling.
Character B: Right?
Character A: So why is no one doing anything about it?
Character B: Do u know how much the pharmaceutical industry is worth today?
Character A: No.
Character B: At least $1.2 bln!
Character A: Explains a lot.

summary: Jess dreamt she was a lion tamer. Lynn believes that dreams mean something. Charlie has read that strangers from our dreams are actually people who we've seen before.
dialogue:
Character C: Guys, last night I dreamt I was a lion tamer, does it mean I should go to Africa this summer? XD
Character B: Or maybe you'll meet a handsome zookeeper? :D
Character A: Or you'll get attacked by a stray cat?
Character B: You've just spoiled all the fun! :P
Character C: Knowing my luck, Charlie might be the closest to the truth.
Character A: Do you really believe that dreams can mean something?
Character C: No, of course not! I was just joking. It was such a surreal dream that I had to share it with you ;)
Character B: Well...
Character C: Do you believe in dreams, Lynn?
Character B: I'm not saying I believe, but I think that sometimes it is possible that our dreams are telling us something. Not like they can show us our future or anything like that, it's just that dreams reflect our subconsciousness, don't you think?
Character C: I guess? 
Character A: I've read somewhere that when we see strangers in our dreams, in fact we must have seen them somewhere before. Our brain is not able to create such images on its own, it must have registered some random people's faces, and it uses them when we dream.
Character C: So you're telling me the circus owner from my dream can really be some gentleman who lives in my neighbourhood?
Character A: Exactly! You don't even remember his face, but after you saw it just once, your brain keeps it somewhere in storage.
Character B: WOW, it sounds really cool!

summary: Coeliac disease makes it impossible to digest gluten. Charles feels bloated and gained weight recently. Monica stopped eating lactose. Charles had a blood test.
dialogue:
Character B: How can you tell that someone has gluten intolerance?
Character D: You can have coeliac disease which makes it impossible for you to digest gluten or be allergic to gluten. From what I've heard, being allergic is far worse, because you have an allergic reaction that can be lethal, while being intolerant can make feel you some unpleasant symptoms, but I don't think may lead to your death
Character A: Why are you asking? Is there something wrong?
Character B: Hm, I don't know, I feel that I may be allergic or something
Character C: Do you have any symptoms? Check those articles:
Character C: <file_other>, <file_other>
Character D: I think that you may have a very very light allergy at best, otherwise you would have known - trust me
Character D: When it comes to intolerance... I know it's very hip to be gluten intolerant, but I don't believe that suddenly half of the population is gluten intolerant. Unless you have a coeliac disease, I think you're fine
Character A: My friend was told that she may be intolerant or allergic and she did a blood test - she's absolutely fine
Character B: I may do it as well. I feel weird recently, bloated and I gain weight even though I don't eat much
Character D: But do you feel differently after eating gluten? Jack's right, you should do a blood test first, but you can test it yourself. Stop eating gluten for a month and see if you feel better
Character C: I did the same thing with lactose, I wasn't feeling great after drinking coffee with milk, etc. I stopped eating it and I'm much better now
Character A: But did it happen suddenly or were you always like this?
Character C: It just happened, I was all right until I wasn't. I don't know how it works, but it happens
Character B: I think it's the same with me. I was fine, but recently it's a real nightmare
Character D: You should quit eating gluten and see, otherwise you should look for a different explanation. Maybe it has nothing to do with food?
Character B: I had a basic blood test and everything's fine. My GP said all my problems are linked to my diet
Character D: It may be, but I'm not so sure. Although, changing your diet and eating healthier can't do you any harm
Character C: You should read the articles I sent you, check the symptoms and what you shouldn't eat
Character B: Thanks! I'm really worried, because it's getting worse and I have no idea what's happening with me
